fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44656].
  {panel}

A user edited his own profile and made a typo so his email adress was invalid.
This was recognized days later, so e.g. all email notifications during that time could not me sent successfully - they are visible in the mail error queue.
The invalid email adress was fixed, but those emails from the error queue would still be sent to the old invalid email adress insteas of the updated.

It would be great, that emails trying to be resent always use the information from the user profile in case an invalid email adress has been updated, so that those emails are not lost forever.
fields.summary: Resent error queue emails to updated email adress when profile updated
Documentation update on Connecting JIRA to Oracle
Document REST API Cookie based authentication

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44651].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When we access to JIRA 6.3.15 and later from IE11, a warning dialog appeared. (Please check the attached image.)
When it comes to a function of attaching a screenshot on IE11, JIRA might not use Java Applet and use functions of HTML5 instead.

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA063/Attaching+a+Screenshot]
{panel}
Browser compatibility notes: If you are using Internet Explorer versions 8-10, the computer you are using will need to be running Java version 1.7+ platform. If you are using Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox or Internet Explorer 11, the screenshot capability takes advantage of HTML5 compatibility. Safari is not supported.
{panel}

[https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-43266]
{panel}
In IE 9 and then 10 an applet is necessary to provide the attach screenshot functionality. It is expected that the user is prompted to update java if necessary to support this functionality.
{panel}

Therefore, the dialog shouldn't appear anymore.
I've already confirmed this dialog is definitely caused by 'Attach Image for JIRA' add-on.
(When I tried to disable the add-on, this problem didn't appear.)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Prepare JIRA 6.3.15 or later
# Install JRE 7 and IE 11 on a client PC (Windows 7)
# Access to the JIRA's login page from the client PC

_Notes: I've already confirm that the same problem didn't happen on JIRA 6.3.0._

h3. Expected Results
The warning dialog like following should never appear on IE11.
{noformat}
This webpage wants to run the following add-on: 'Java SE Runtime Environment 7 Update 80' from 'Oracle America, Inc.'.
{noformat}

h3. Actual Results
The warning dialog appeared.
fields.summary: IE11 shows warnings about using JAVA even though JIRA 6.3.15 and later doesn't use Java Applet for attaching screenshot anymore

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44649].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently the Connection Pool graph only shows statistics for the past 6 hours, hence anything above 6 hours will not be shown

!Database_Monitoring.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow customisable duration for the graph so it can spans for a longer time range
fields.summary: Increase Duration Range of Database Monitoring tool for Connection Pool

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44647].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, executing .bin or .exe installers creates install4j (something like {{i4j_log_JIRA_xxxxxxx.log}}) file in /tmp directory and deletes the log after the process end.

h3. Suggested Solution
To have the ability to add "-debug" option while executing the installers. By this, there will be logs created such as install.log and upgrade.log respectively. 
*Note*: It's even better if we can obtain logs for installation and upgrade by default. :)
fields.summary: The ability to add "-debug" option while executing installers so that respective logs will be created.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44645].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
JIRA upgrade fails because jira.home value is not specified in {{jira-aplication.properties}} file. The following error will be thrown in the terminal:
{noformat}
[root@xxxx]# ./atlassian-jira-6.4.6-x64.bin
Unpacking JRE ...
Starting Installer ...
Jul 09, 2015 4:51:04 PM java.util.prefs.FileSystemPreferences$2 run
INFO: Created system preferences directory in java.home.

This will install JIRA 6.4.6 on your computer.
OK [o, Enter], Cancel [c]
o
Choose the appropriate installation or upgrade option.
Please choose one of the following:
Express Install (use default settings) [1], Custom Install (recommended for advanced users) [2], Upgrade an existing JIRA installation [3, Enter]
3
Existing installation directory:
[/opt/atlassian/jira/atlassian-jira-6.1.7-standalone]

An error occurred when parsing your installation directory. Unfortunately the installer will be unable to continue with the automated upgrade.
Finishing installation ...
[root@xxxx]#
{noformat} 

The jira.home directory is removed from {{jira-aplication.properties}} and defined in the JVM argument {{-Djira.home=/opt/atlassian/jira/home}}.

h3. Suggested Solution
# Have the ability for the installer to look at the JVM argument if jira.home value in {{jira-aplication.properties}} is null. Perhaps, ask user to verify the jira.home value if found in non-default place ({{jira-aplication.properties}}).
# More accurate error to be shown in the terminal instead of {{An error occurred when parsing your installation directory. Unfortunately the installer will be unable to continue with the automated upgrade.}}.
fields.summary: The ability for installer to look at JVM arguments for jira.home value.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44642].

h3. Problem Definition
Customer would like for the JIRA 'Create' button to redirect to their Service Desk Customer Portal for issue creation instead of linking to {{https://hostname/secure/CreateIssue!default.jspa}}

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the ability to modify the URL the Create Button links to for creating issues

or
* Use the "Create Service Desk Request" option from the Service Desk top menu.
fields.summary: Change JIRA 'Create' Button URL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44641].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Customer is looking for the ability to disable 'Autowatch own Issues' in the User Default Settings based on the user's Group Membership; ie disable auto-watching for specific users

h3. Suggested Solution
Add the ability to Disable 'Autowatch own issues' by Group Membership
 
h3. Workaround 
None, 'Autowatch own issues' is a global setting.  It can either be disabled globally or each user can disable it in their Profile Settings
fields.summary: Disable Autowatch Own Issues by Group Membership

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44639].
  {panel}

In the image below, there is a double-ended arrow between *Resolved* and *Waiting for QA*. This image is ambiguous and leaves some room for interpretation.

!2015-08-04 18_55_43-WCS Default Workflow 3.1 - novomind JIRA.png!

# There must be a transition from *Resolved* to *Waiting for QA*. This is because all the vertical lines bend to the left, so the only possible beginning for an arrow is in the *Resolved* box.
# There might be a transition from *Waiting for QA* to *Resolved*. Or there might not. The image doesn’t tell anything about that.
# The vertical lines are connected to *Resolved*, but it is not clear from this part of the image whether they are incoming or outgoing. One would have to follow them to their other end, where the same ambiguities as above could appear.

To solve this ambiguity, incoming and outgoing arrows should never overlap at a box. One way to do that is to have two access points at each edge of a box. All incoming arrows end at the access point that is nearer to the top left corner, and all outgoing arrows end at the access point that is nearer to the bottom right corner. (For RTL-written languages, the top-right and bottom-left corners might be used instead, to follow the natural reading directions.)

!Proposal for arranging the arrows.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: View Workflow Dialog lets arrows enter and leave a state at the same pixel

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44638].
  {panel}

I have 350 projects for which I need to migrate the Workflow Scheme, Issue Type Scheme and Issue Type Screen Scheme.

I also need to change the Field Configurations. About 300 of those projects don't even have a Field Configuration Scheme. They use the Default Field Configuration.

For Issue Types, I took me less than an hour since there is an "Associate" operation on the Issue Type Scheme management page. I could set the desired migration parameters and let the tool run the migration in batch.

For the other parameters, It will take me *days* to go through all the clicks! Please do something about this!

I hope this fits well with the scope of issue JRA-3156.
fields.summary: Add an "Associate" operation to Fields, Screens and Workflows

please accept my request
Appointment Booking application

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44633].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Project admins are able to configure their Projects Roles and choose groups which they want to be part of a role. They are able to choose the group *jira-users* as well as other groups, some of which are groups which all users in JIRA are members of it. 

Allowing project admins to choose *jira-users* might be useful for some, but for others this might be a big problem especially when they have their Notification Scheme configured to send notifications to entire Project Roles. 

Project Admin unknowingly adds this group to the role causing all users to receive unwanted notifications.

h3. Suggestion
Make it configurable to hide certain groups so that Project Admins will not be able to choose them, or maybe only users with *JIRA System Administrators* permission can choose them.
fields.summary: Hide certain groups when configuring Project Roles

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44627].
  {panel}

It would be nice to be able to filter for issues Not fixed in a specific version.

Suppose I've 3 versions : X,Y,Z
And 3 issues :
A, fixed in X
B, fixed in X and Y
C, fixed in Z

I want to get issues fixed in Y or Z, but not in X.
That is, only C. (if I check Y and Z, I'll get B too)

Note the same wish is applicable to every multivalued field.

The "Fixed in" field only allows selection on _positive_ searching (issue _must_ be fixed in version X), it should :
- either allow selection on positive or negative searching (issue _must_ / _mustn't_ be fixed in version X)
- or there should be two entries in field selection : Fixed in version / NOT Fixed in version

EDIT :
I just thought this is possible in advanced JQL, by typing : 
AND fixVersion IN ("Y","Z") AND fixVersion NOT IN ("A")

This is not intuitive (it's like writing "a=1 AND a=2").
fields.summary: Filter on : "NOT fixed in version X"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44612].
  {panel}

Currently, on JIRA Workflow Post Function we could configured it to automatically assigned to a certain user using the Post Function when a transition is triggered. But, this could confuse users if the assignee field is shown on the transition screen and still selectable. As when the user is selecting any user, whomever the selected user is, it would change back to the user that is specified on the Post Function.

In this case, some improvement could be made like:
- Lock the assignee field, but still show the username that is specified on the Post Function.
- The assignee field is still shown and selectable, but when selecting other user it would override the Post Function.
fields.summary: Assigned Field to show the Username that is specified on the "Assigned to" post function.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44601].
  {panel}

After clicking "create" (submit) on the create issue dialog, a spinner comes up. Occasionally this spinner goes away and the issue is created but the dialog itself doesn't go away.

This introduces the opportunity for me to create duplicate issues. 

Additionally, there is no way to recover besides opening a new tab, and clicking on the "issues" drop down in order to check that my issue was indeed created. The reason that there is no way to recover is because the create dialog obscures the underlying content thus making the navigational elements of JIRA unavailable. 

For a novice computer user, for example one who doesn't understand tabs well, I would be faced with the decision to either:
a) Click create again and hope it works this time (thus creating a duplicate issue)
b) Hit cancel in the hopes that my issue had actually been created with the risk of losing the data that I had put into the create dialog.
fields.summary: Create issue dialog stops "spinning" with no obvious side effect
Configuring "What's New" dialog for JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44595].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The use of the Agile Simplified Workflow enables project administrators to create issue statuses. Statuses from other boards are not visible when they are doing this from the Board Administration UI. This means many different issue statuses are created.

This makes it really difficult to manage the sort order or issue statuses.  Currently the statuses are presented in one big list with only "1 up" and "1 down" links to reorder them.  

h3. Suggested Solution

Add a multi-select field listing all the projects.  When an admin selects projects in the field the list of issue statuses is shortened to only those present in the issue status schemes of the projects.

Add a multi-select field listing all the JIRA Agile boards.  When an admin selects boards in the field the list of issue statuses is shortened to only those mapped to columns in those boards.
fields.summary: Ability to manage sequence of a subset of issue statuses for specific projects or boards

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44594].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The use of the Agile Simplified Workflow enables project administrators to create issue statuses.  Statuses from other boards are not visible when they are doing this from the Board Administration UI.  This means many different issue statuses are created.

When searching this results in a very large list of issue status suggestions.  The searcher can't tell which ones are valid for a given set of projects or boards.

h3. Suggested Solution
A JQL function to suggest a constrained list of issue states.  This is just one idea, a different solution to the problem would be welcome.

Perhaps this would look like...
{code:borderStyle=solid}
status IN projectIssueStates((PROJECT_NAME [, PROJECT_NAME, ...]), (STATUS [, STATUS, ...]))
status IN boardIssueStates((BOARD_NAME [, BOARD_NAME, ...]), (STATUS [, STATUS, ...]))
{code}

By specifying a list of projects or boards to use as a constraint a sub-set of the global list of statuses can be suggested.  This saves the user from trying to determine the list of statuses used by the project or board.

Alternatively and perhaps more generally useful, use a sub-query to pull a list of issues then use the statuses from that list as suggestions.  Example:

{code:borderStyle=solid}
status IN filteredIssueStates("Project = TEST AND issueType != 'Epic'", (STATUS [, STATUS, ...]))
{code}

The suggested list would only include statuses present in the filtered list of issues.

NOTE: Consideration should be given to whether or not this would prevent referencing _other_ issue statuses.  In other words, if project TEST only has issues in Open, InProgress, and Done should the function allow an issue status list of (Open, InProgress, Done, PendingReview) or flag this as invalid?

h3. Workaround 

These are not great workarounds so please comment if you have other ideas.

* Ask and train project owners to prefix the statuses they create with their project key. Example: PROJA Waiting Approval.
* Ask/train project owners to maintain a list of statuses that are valid for their project to aid them in searching.  Others can refer to the project summary or Agile board to identify the statuses available.
fields.summary: Ability to constrain the list of suggested statuses in a JQL search to those that are valid for specific projects or boards

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44578].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The references to GlobalId in [issuesWithRemoteLinksByGlobalId() documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Advanced+Searching+Functions#AdvancedSearchingFunctions-issuesWithRemoteLinksByGlobalId()] can be confusing or atleast obscure, in that it doesn't explain where the GlobalIds come from or how to retrieve them. Also, it's not clear if GlobalIds are only auto-generated or if they can be set explicitly e.g. for remote links added via REST API; or if they can be retrieved in an easy way other than from the database.

h3. Suggested Solution
Explain more or include a link to further definition on remote link GlobalID, and how a user could retrieve it for use in the issuesWithRemoteLinksByGlobalId() function.
fields.summary: Explain the concept and realistic usage examples of remote links GlobalId

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44576].
  {panel}

In the Jira documentation, page "Migrating JIRA to Another Server' the following is stated in section 4, post migration checks:

"ensure that the production license is updated for the new server ID"

However, if i export and import data from an existing system, the server ID and licenses appear to come with the data in line with the description on this page:

https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=151519275

I am now unsure as to whether to generate a new server Id or not.  I am planning to move from a 10 user license to 25 user license and think I should use the same server id
fields.summary: Documentation query
Redirect requests that have a different HOST header than what JIRA is configured to serve for to the correct (configured) JIRA server url.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44569].
  {panel}

As per the documentation in https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Creating+Issues+and+Comments+from+Email , when a mail handler process an email, it first try to locate an issue key using the summary or the in-reply-to header and happen the email that issue, otherwise creating an issue on the configured project for the mail handler.

This can cause conflict in a setup where email addresses, mail handler and project are 1 to 1.
A mail handler could add a comment to another issue which has a similar key in the subject.

It would be convenient to have an option to have a mail handler be exclusive to a project, on creation AND commenting.

The logic would be:
Search in summary or in-reply-to header for an issue key.
If key exist AND issue is the mail handler project : Add comment
Otherwise Create issue in the mail handler project
fields.summary: Allow mail handler to only manage a specific project
LDAP users data integrity checker

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44564].
{panel}
It would be easier if an option to Bulk edit the Resolution date rather than doing it on a database level one by one.
h3. wokraround

As per the ["Is there a way to change the "Resolution Date" thread in the Atlassian Community|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/Is-there-a-way-to-change-the-quot-Resolution-Date-quot-in-Jira/qaq-p/385739], in order to update the resolution dates you need a CSV file with at least the below 4 fields:
 # Issue Key
 # Summary
 # Resolution
 # Resolved (to be mapped to "Date Resolved")
fields.summary: Add the Option to Change the Resolution Date in Bulk Edit
Can't set priority to Super Duper
Stop/disable  "Smart querying activated. Run search without smart query"
does not render well

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44558].
  {panel}

Hi JIRA Product Management Team,

Currently, my company is using Jira & Confluence.

And now, my company has a need of analyzing a project based on project properties.

For example, our need are 
* to list all projects and group by project technology and/or business lines/ business entities 
* to analyze time spent of projects based on a specified project technology and/or a specified business lines/ business entities

When creating a project, I can use category field to clarifying but only one field is not enough

I also found a add-on which name is Profield can help me to add more custom field to a project and analyze based on those fields

However, I'd like this feature (will have more filed to clarify a project instead of only one "category" field) can integrate into Jira rather using an add-on of third party. So, my question is: does your company intend to add this feature to your product in future (Jira) ?

Thanks for your support,

Lam Nguyen Hoang | QA Manager
lam.nguyenhoang@pycogroup.com
_______________________________________
{color:#59afe1}*PYCO*GROUP{color}
DIGITAL / CONSULTING / VENTURES
Belgium / France / Hong-Kong / South Africa / USA / Vietnam
[https://www.facebook.com/PYCO.Digital.VN]  |  [http://www.linkedin.com/company/642427]
fields.summary: Need having more fields to clarify a project

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44548].
  {panel}

Environment: Jira OnDemand, v. 6.5-OD-08-001 

Suggestions are not shown in Basic search for custom fields of type "Label".

When I search by a builtin Label field, I can see a list of suggested values I can choose from (see "jira-builtin-label.png")
For custom field of type "Label", suggested values are not shown and the only way to search by this custom field is to specify the exact custom label value - see "jira-custom-label.png", the custom field name is "Branch". 
Note that there are indeed several issues which have "Branch" specified.
Re-indexing does not help.
fields.summary: Suggestions are not shown in Basic search for custom fields of type "Label"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44547].
  {panel}

h4. Problem
Certain documentations in [developer.atlassian.com|https://developer.atlassian.com] are out of date, which can raise questions from customers.
\\

h4. Suggestion
* Update [Enabling the RPC plugin|https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/jira-apis/jira-api-status/jira-rpc-services/enabling-the-rpc-plugin] with the new path to the *Manage Add-ons* page and updated screenshots.
* Remove references to our SVN repository (svn.atlassian.com) as that is no longer available. For example: [Remote API (XML-RPC) Examples|https://developer.atlassian.com/jiradev/jira-apis/jira-api-status/jira-rpc-services/jira-xml-rpc-overview/remote-api-xml-rpc-examples]
fields.summary: Update Remote API documentation in developer.atlassian.com

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44546].
  {panel}

As of now, JIRA creates Issue Types in English first (irrespective of the instance language). After that, if you create projects, it adds new issue types in that language. However, the issue types in English are always there.

This can be confusing for the administrator. 

Steps to reproduce : 
# Set up a new instance and choose any language (other than English) in the beginning of the installation. I tested with German.
# Now proceed with the installation
# After the installation is complete, check the issue types on the instance
# Notice all issue types are created in English
# Now create a project
# Notice that now new issue types are created in the instance language.
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like JIRA to create default issue types in the instance language

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44539].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Every so often, customers migrate from JIRA Cloud to JIRA Server, and support Engineers sometimes need to restore customer data on particular JIRA builds, when they do this they may need to compare build numbers of different JIRA versions.

Currently this is done by referencing this KB: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/JIRA+Build+and+Version+Numbers+Reference

The KB is updated manually and as a result will fall out of sync with the latest version, this should be done as part of the release process.

h3. Suggested Solution
Instead of using a manually updated KB this information should be in developer.atlassian.com somewhere - look at how Confluence handles this https://developer.atlassian.com/confdev/development-resources/confluence-build-information
fields.summary: Add JIRA Build Information to developer.atlassian.com

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44529].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Resolved / Closed notifications are not sent to custom groups

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom group
# Add users to the group
# Set the notification scheme to be sent to the custom group for *_Close Issue_* and _*Resolve Issue*_ event.
# Close / Resolve issue

h3. Expected Results
Custom groups that are set in the notification scheme should receive an email when the issue is Closed / Resolved

h3. Actual Results
All default groups or individual set to receive the notification, but the custom group will not receive the notification. No error messages are logged
fields.summary: Resolved / Closed notifications are not sent to custom groups

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44527].
  {panel}

JIRA markup language doesn't allow inline display of images with filenames containing a valid JIRA key

Here is awesomeface.jpg

!awesomeface.jpg!

And here is the same image, but now it's called JRA-44527.jpg

!JRA-44527.jpg!

And here is the same image, but now it's called JRA-44527withsuffix.jpg

!JRA-44527withsuffix.jpg!

And here is the same image, but now it's called prefixed_JRA-44527.jpg

!prefixed_JRA-44527.jpg!
fields.summary: JIRA markup language doesn't allow inline display of images with filenames containing something that matches a JIRA key

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44526].
  {panel}

Creating issue through email doesn't populate Require Radio Button Custom Field with it's default Value.

h4. Steps to reproduce:

- Create a new Radio Button Custom Field (Test Field) with a few option.
- Define a Default Value to it.
- Set the field as required and properly assign it to a project.
- Create a Issue through email

h4. Expected Result

Issue created with the Default Value set.

h4. Actually Result.

Issue is created without any value for Test Field
fields.summary: Default Value for Radio Button Custom Field not set through email.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44519].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When changes are made to the *User Object Filter*, for example removing a user from the external directory, there is no warning in the UI. In such cases, users that are removed from Local Groups will lose their membership although the change to the *User Object Filter* are reverted. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add warning message in the UI to notify administrators that user(s) will be removed from group membership when *User Object Filter* is modified.
fields.summary: Warning when changes are made to the User Object Filter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44517].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Default Text Renderer can't recognize URLs including backslash character as hyperlinks.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set "Description" field of issues to use Default Text Renderer.
# Create an issue.
# Put some URL including some backslash character in Description field.

h3. Expected Results
The URL should be shown as a hyperlink.

h3. Actual Results
Only a string before "\" in the URL is recognized as a hyperlink and the other string is recognized as a normal text.
 
h3.Workaround
There are no workaround.
fields.summary: Default Text Renderer can't recognize URLs including backslash character as hyperlinks

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44493].
  {panel}

Please update the {{Please note}} section from the [Uninstalling JIRA from Linux|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Uninstalling+JIRA+from+Linux] documentation to include the information that the database is not deleted when running the uninstaller.

The suggestion for the change is like follows (change already applied to the online 6.4.x document version):

{quote}
Please note:

    * All files within the JIRA Installation Directory will be deleted (with the exception of the Tomcat log folder located in the JIRA Installation Directory).
    * The uninstaller will NOT delete:
       ** The JIRA database
       ** The JIRA Home Directory
       ** Log files that were generated while JIRA was running
    * The uninstaller can be made to operate in unattended mode by specifying the -q option — i.e. uninstall -q
{quote}

Thanks!
fields.summary: Update the 'Uninstalling JIRA from Linux' documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44486].
  {panel}

Based on the following documentation; [Advanced Searching Functions - startOfWeek()|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Advanced+Searching+Functions#AdvancedSearchingFunctions-startOfWeek()], the result of startOfWeek() function is depends upon your locale. 

Some customers wants to maintain their locale, but want to change the day the week starts in JIRA. As a workaround, startOfWeek("inc") function accept increment where inc is an optional increment of (+/-)nn(y|M|w|d|h|m). For example, if user wants to make:
* Sunday to be the start of week: startOfWeek("-1d")
* Saturday to be the start of week: startOfWeek()
* Monday to be the start of week: startOfWeek("+1d")
fields.summary: Update documentation on Advanced Searching Functions - startOfWeek()

fields.description:

Some customers wants to maintain their locale, but want to change the day the week starts in JIRA. As a workaround, startOfWeek("inc") function accept increment where inc is an optional increment of (+/-)nn(y|M|w|d|h|m). For example, if user wants to make:
* Sunday to be the start of week: startOfWeek("-1d")
* Saturday to be the start of week: startOfWeek()
* Monday to be the start of week: startOfWeek("+1d")

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44474].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
If an issue is part of an Epic and also has sub-tasks, then the sub-task does not contain the Epic Link field. This makes it very difficult to run reporting on all issues with an Epic.


h3. Suggested Workaround
Use Script Runner (or any other plugin) to copy the field "Epic Link" to the some field on Sub-tasks. This would help to query the sub-tasks on the issue navigator.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like the "Epic Link" field to be available to the sub-tasks.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-44473].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
* When changing assignee, if previous assignee is having the same first name with the assignee, only the first name is strikeout and left out the last name. Seems like the user change their last name
* See attachment
** ahmad albab ---> ahmad azfar
** Сергей Артемов --> Сергей Михайлов

h3. Suggested Solution
* To strikeout completely the name to avoid confusion
* Remove the change if it contains sensitive information such as email address.
